[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Single Transaction] When state.num_txns() == 1, can boundary conditions in partition calculations cause incorrect behavior or panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Single Shard] When num_executor_shards == 1, do both partitioner implementations correctly assign all transactions to shard 0, or can off-by-one errors cause issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Max Block Size] Can processing blocks at the maximum size limit (e.g., 10,000 transactions) trigger integer overflow or excessive memory allocation in partition calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Zero Keys] If a block contains transactions with empty read/write sets, can this cause division by zero or empty set errors in conflict tracking? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Edge Cases] [Duplicate Keys] Can transactions with duplicate storage keys in their read/write sets cause incorrect connected component formation or double-counting in conflict analysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Performance DoS] [Quadratic Complexity] Can an attacker craft blocks that cause O(nÂ²) behavior in union-find or LPT scheduling, degrading validator performance to unusable levels? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Performance DoS] [Pathological Partitioning] Can adversarial transaction patterns force the partitioner into worst-case behavior, causing excessive CPU usage that impacts consensus participation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Performance DoS] [Lock Contention] Can high contention on state.sender_idx_table or state.key_idx_table RwLocks cause severe performance degradation during partition processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [LPT Scheduling] [Task Size Overflow] Can group sizes cast to u64 overflow when blocks contain extremely large transaction groups, causing incorrect load balancing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [LPT Scheduling] [Shard Assignment] Can the LPT algorithm assign groups to invalid shard IDs outside the range 0..num_executor_shards, causing indexing errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [LPT Scheduling] [Longest Pole] Does the longest_processing_time_first function guarantee that the longest pole doesn't exceed the theoretical limit, or can poor scheduling cause extreme load imbalance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Transaction Ordering] [Sender Ordering] Does the partitioner preserve the relative order of transactions from the same sender, or can reordering break sequence number requirements and cause transaction failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Transaction Ordering] [Intra-Shard Ordering] Within each shard's pre_partitioned vector, are transactions guaranteed to maintain their original order, or can shuffling violate execution dependencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Transaction Ordering] [Global Ordering] When reassembling results from all shards, can the partitioning break the global transaction order required for deterministic execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [State Consistency] [Random Seed] If partitioning involves any randomness (e.g., HashMap iteration), can this cause validators to produce different partitions and break consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [State Consistency] [Floating Point Precision] Can floating-point arithmetic in load_imbalance_tolerance calculations produce different results on different CPU architectures, breaking determinism? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [State Consistency] [Implementation Variation] Can subtle differences in Rust standard library behavior across versions cause non-deterministic partitioning between validators running different Rust versions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Union-Find] [Path Compression] If the UnionFind implementation uses path compression, can this introduce non-determinism that causes different validators to produce different partition results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Union-Find] [Union by Rank] Can incorrect union-by-rank implementation cause inefficient tree structures that degrade union-find performance to O(n) per operation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Union-Find] [Index Translation] When translating between sender indices and key indices using num_senders + key_idx, can integer overflow cause incorrect index calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Union-Find] [Disjoint Set Count] Can an attacker craft transactions to maximize the number of disjoint sets, causing excessive memory usage in the union-find structure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Read/Write Sets] [Read-Only Transactions] Are read-only transactions (empty write_sets) correctly handled, or can they cause issues in conflict detection and partitioning? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Read/Write Sets] [Write-Only Transactions] Can transactions with empty read_sets but non-empty write_sets cause incorrect connected component formation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Read/Write Sets] [Set Intersection] When processing read/write sets for conflict detection, can incorrect set operations cause false positives or false negatives in conflict identification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Concurrency] [ThreadPool Panic] If a thread in the thread_pool panics during async drop, can this cause resource leaks or leave the partitioner in an inconsistent state? (Medium)
